snippet: A judge said the case against Rosean S. Hargrave, which was built in part on the work of Detective Louis Scarcella, was deeply flawed and unfair.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice ShawnDya L Simpson overturns 1991 conviction of Rosean S Hargrave who, at 17 years old, was sentenced to 30 years to life for murder of off-duty correction officer; says prosecution's case was based on flawed detective work by former police detective Louis Scarcella, whose investigative methods have come under scrutiny; six convictions that were based on evidence given by Scarcella have been overturned since Brooklyn district attorney’s office began its review of his old cases in 2013.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: A judge said the case against Rosean S. Hargrave, which was built in part on the work of Detective Louis Scarcella, was deeply flawed and unfair.

headline.main: Man Convicted in Murder Investigated by Scarcella Is Ordered Freed
headline.print_headline: Convicted of 1991 Murder, Man Is Ordered Released
